Changing a View Profile

The Windows client allows you to create view profiles, which are workstation-dependent sets of limitations applied to a view. You can create as many profiles for use on your workstation as you wish. Profiles specify which folders are visible and which EOL (end-of-line) and case-sensitive file path settings apply to those folders.

For example, if you are building a UNIX version and a Windows version of a product from the same view, you may need a profile for each. UNIX expects paths to be case sensitive and uses a linefeed as the EOL character in a text file, while Windows paths are not case sensitive and Windows text files use the carriage return/linefeed combination to indicate the EOL.

Every view has at least one profile named Default, but new profiles can be created based on default settings or previous profiles. The name of the current profile displays near the end of the title bar.

Any changes made to a folder’s visibility, EOL, and case-sensitive file path settings automatically become part of the currently selected profile. Therefore, before changing a view profile, you should verify that you have selected the correct profile.

Note: For the Cross-Platform client, EOL settings are specified in Tools > Personal Options on the File tab.

To select a specific view profile (Windows client):

  1. Select View > Profiles from the menu. The View Profiles dialog opens.

  2. Highlight the correct profile, and click Select.

  3. Click Close.

To change a view profile (Windows client):

  1. Select the folder that you want to change.

  2. Select Folder > Properties from the menu. The Folder Properties dialog opens.

  3. To make the folder visible or invisible, select or clear the Visible check box. When a folder is invisible in a given profile, its name remains in the folder hierarchy, but the color of its icon changes from yellow to white, and its contents are no longer displayed.

  4. To control the folder's EOL characters and path case sensitivity:

    1. Select the Files tab.

    2. In the EOL Conversion group box, select or clear the Override for this folder and all its child folders check box to change this setting for the folder and its children.

    3. Select the option button for the appropriate EOL marker.

    4. In the File path conventions group box, select or clear the Override for this folder and all its child folders check box to change this setting for the folder and its children.

    5. Select or clear the Case sensitive file paths check box.

  5. When the changes are complete, click OK.
